Description: Body sherd of Attic, probably black-figured pottery cup, Gordion cup or little-master cup; interior: wall glazed; tondo border part preserved, consisting of dot-band between groups of three bands; exterior: part of black handle-palmette and volute in handle zone; bowl glazed with reserved band.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.434.
Bibliographic references: Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 146-8, no. 7)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 383-4, no. B541)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 231, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0435) (Phase 1)
Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 556, no. G13)
